Key Match Events: Wales were unable to take advantage during the second half and the match came down to a shootout.
Daniel James needed to score to keep the shootout on track but his shot was saved by Szczesny.
Pre-Game Insights: Wales manager Rob Page said 'there's nerves' ahead of the match.
Page emphasized that Wales were the better team for the majority of the evening.
Rob Page expressed pride in the group despite the loss and mentioned that the team is going somewhere.
Post-Match Reflections: Wales manager Rob Page said it was a cruel game and that he was proud of the group.
Ben Davies, Wales captain, expressed disappointment but highlighted the character shown by the players.
Joe Allen, former Wales midfielder, praised Dan James and expressed pride in the boys despite the loss.
It's noted that Wales are a team in transition after the loss of Gareth Bale and Aaron Ramsey.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Wales suffered heartbreak in their first-ever penalty shoot-out.
Poland secured their place at Euro 2024 after defeating Wales in a penalty shootout 5-4.
Chris Mepham was sent off for a second yellow card in the final seconds of the match.
